LIBFLIAPI FLIGrabFrame

(flidev_t dev, void* buff, size_t buffsize,
  size_t* bytesgrabbed)

Grab a frame from a given camera.

Documentation

Grab a frame from a given camera. This function grabs a complete frame (image) according to the settings (image area, exposure time, bit depth, etc.) of camera dev. Up to buffsize bytes of the grabbed image are placed into the buffer pointed to by buff, and the actual number of bytes grabbed is placed in the location pointed to by bytesgrabbed. The settings of dev must be valid for the camera device. They are set by calling the appropriate set library functions. This function returns after the frame has been exposed and the image is acquired. This includes starting the exposure, waiting until the exposure is complete, flushing rows above the image area, grabbing all rows of the image, and flushing any remaining rows below the image.
Parameters:
dev - Camera to grab frame of.
buff - Pointer to where the grabbed frame will be placed.
buffsize - The size in bytes of the buffer pointed to by buff.
bytesgrabbed - Pointer to where the actual number of bytes grabbed will be placed.
Returns:
Zero on success.
Non-zero on failure.
